When the crew of the Enterprise learn of a Federation conspiracy against the inhabitants of a unique planet, Captain Picard begins an open rebellion." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120844/","name":"Star Trek: Insurrection","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWEzZDI0NjEtY2FkMC00ZjQwLWI2YzgtZDEyMzMwZmRlZDlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When the crew of the Enterprise learn of a Federation conspiracy against the inhabitants of a unique planet, Captain Picard begins an open rebellion.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120844/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"riddion"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hugely underrated","reviewBody":"I am a big Star Trek fan and I have loved it from the first moment I saw it. I remember seeing Star Trek the first time with Star Trek 4 - The Voyage Home and The Next Generation series and I remember being at awe at the wonder of it all. It has been many years since then, and having watched the all the series and movies many times, especially the movies since they take such a sorter time to watch, it is clear to me that this movie depicts the very heart of Star Trek. Do we have the right to tell other people where to live and how to live? It is about tollerance and thinking of others before ourselves. The movies has so many magical moments and it very clearly dismisses the myth that the odd-numbered movies are worse than the others. It is not so much an action science fiction as First Contact, but Star Trek is NOT about action. I guess this is why I like the episodes with virtually no action and much character development and tests on the characters and how they cope with different situations the best. The movies does have some cliché dialog, like when Data saying 'Sattle up. Lock and load', but Star Trek is no famous for it's one-liners.\n\nI may be in the minority when it comes to this movie, but I think it is important to defend this great Star Trek movie, especially since the really bad Nemisis came out. We have to judge this movies on it's own merits and on the idea of what Star Trek is all about.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":73075,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1998-12-11","keywords":"sex in a hot tub,kissing while having sex,male alien,male android,jean luc picard character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Star Trek: Insurrection","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1299231769","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2E3NWUwZWMtMzM1MC00MDJmLTg0YWItZTVjMWJiZDY5M2UwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2E3NWUwZWMtMzM1MC00MDJmLTg0YWItZTVjMWJiZDY5M2UwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001772/","name":"Patrick Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000408/","name":"Jonathan Frakes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000653/","name":"Brent Spiner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000408/","name":"Jonathan Frakes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0437457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734472/","name":"Gene Roddenberry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075834/","name":"Rick Berman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0683522/","name":"Michael Piller"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Star Trek: Nemesis: Directed by Stuart Baird. With Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner, LeVar Burton. The Enterprise is diverted to the Romulan homeworld Romulus, supposedly because they want to negotiate a peace treaty. Captain Picard and his crew discover a serious threat to the Federation once Praetor Shinzon plans to attack Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253754/","name":"Star Trek: Nemesis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNjY2NDY3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA0MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Enterprise is diverted to the Romulan homeworld Romulus, supposedly because they want to negotiate a peace treaty. Captain Picard and his crew discover a serious threat to the Federation once Praetor Shinzon plans to attack Earth","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253754/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"foo_fighter3"},"dateCreated":"2003-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Can't wait for the DVD!","reviewBody":"I loved it.

I used to be a real Trekky several years ago, but kind of grew out of it. This was the kind of Star Trek film I had been waiting to see. Much more involving than Insurrection and an intriguing story that I thought just got better as the film went on.

Brent Spiner did a masterful job with his two roles.

The special effects were like nothing I had ever seen from Star Trek before. They were brilliantly created and went beyond the typical Star Trek style effects which added extra depth to the film.

I have been told that many pure Star Trek fans did not like this film. And I agree that it seemed rather 'un-Star Trek' in many ways. But I think it was these un-Star Trek elements that really boosted this film.

It comes in at number 2 of my favorite Star Trek films. Second only to Wrath of Khan. Or perhaps a draw."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":76738,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2002-12-13","keywords":"universe,starship versus starship,velocity,based on cult favorite,fictional war","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Star Trek: Nemesis","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3498705177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTEzYzU0NjktNWM1Yy00Y2EwLWJmZDQtZTI4MzgzNDFjNzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTEzYzU0NjktNWM1Yy00Y2EwLWJmZDQtZTI4MzgzNDFjNzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001772/","name":"Patrick Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000408/","name":"Jonathan Frakes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000653/","name":"Brent Spiner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000829/","name":"Stuart Baird"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0437457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734472/","name":"Gene Roddenberry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0517589/","name":"John Logan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075834/","name":"Rick Berman"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0253754, Title: Star Trek: Nemesis, --- Description: Star Trek: Nemesis: Directed by Stuart Baird. With Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner, LeVar Burton. The Enterprise is diverted to the Romulan homeworld Romulus, supposedly because they want to negotiate a peace treaty. Captain Picard and his crew discover a serious threat to the Federation once Praetor Shinzon plans to attack Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253754/","name":"Star Trek: Nemesis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNjY2NDY3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA0MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Enterprise is diverted to the Romulan homeworld Romulus, supposedly because they want to negotiate a peace treaty. Captain Picard and his crew discover a serious threat to the Federation once Praetor Shinzon plans to attack Earth","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253754/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"foo_fighter3","dateCreated":"2003-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Can't wait for the DVD!","reviewBody":"I loved it.

I used to be a real Trekky several years ago, but kind of grew out of it. This was the kind of Star Trek film I had been waiting to see. Much more involving than Insurrection and an intriguing story that I thought just got better as the film went on.

Brent Spiner did a masterful job with his two roles.

The special effects were like nothing I had ever seen from Star Trek before. They were brilliantly created and went beyond the typical Star Trek style effects which added extra depth to the film.

I have been told that many pure Star Trek fans did not like this film. And I agree that it seemed rather 'un-Star Trek' in many ways. But I think it was these un-Star Trek elements that really boosted this film.

It comes in at number 2 of my favorite Star Trek films. Second only to Wrath of Khan.
